byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle contributed reporting from West Chester, Pa.
byline.original: By ERIN McCANN and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Thousands of faculty members at Pennsylvania state colleges and universities go on strike amid disputes over salaries, benefits and increasing reliance on adjunct faculty; walkout reflects increasing influence of labor issues in higher education.

headline.print_headline: Thousands of Instructors Walk Off Jobs at Universities
headline.main: Faculty Members at 14 State Universities in Pennsylvania Go on Strike

snippet: A union representing more than 5,000 professors and coaches who teach more than 100,000 students has been without a contract since June 2015....
lead_paragraph: A union representing more than 5,000 professors and coaches who teach more than 100,000 students has been without a contract since June 2015.
